{\n       setDeleting(true)\n       \n       try {\n         const response = await fetch('/api/account', {\n           method: 'DELETE',\n         })\n         \n         if (response.ok) {\n           await clearLocalCache()\n           router.push('/login')\n         }\n       } finally {\n         setDeleting(false)\n       }\n     }\n     \n     return (\n       &lt;div className=\"max-w-2xl mx-auto px-4 py-6\"&gt;\n         &lt;h1 className=\"text-2xl font-bold mb-6\"&gt;Settings&lt;/h1&gt;\n         \n         &lt;div className=\"space-y-6\"&gt;\n           {/* Appearance */}\n           &lt;section className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg p-6\"&gt;\n             &lt;h2 className=\"font-medium text-lg mb-4\"&gt;Appearance&lt;/h2&gt;\n             \n             &lt;div className=\"space-y-3\"&gt;\n               &lt;label className=\"flex items-center gap-3\"&gt;\n                 &lt;input\n                   type=\"radio\"\n                   name=\"theme\"\n                   checked={theme === 'light'}\n                   onChange={() =&gt; setTheme('light')}\n                   className=\"w-4 h-4\"\n                 /&gt;\n                 &lt;span&gt;Light&lt;/span&gt;\n               &lt;/label&gt;\n               &lt;label className=\"flex items-center gap-3\"&gt;\n                 &lt;input\n                   type=\"radio\"\n                   name=\"theme\"\n                   checked={theme === 'dark'}\n                   onChange={() =&gt; setTheme('dark')}\n                   className=\"w-4 h-4\"\n                 /&gt;\n                 &lt;span&gt;Dark&lt;/span&gt;\n               &lt;/label&gt;\n               &lt;label className=\"flex items-center gap-3\"&gt;\n                 &lt;input\n                   type=\"radio\"\n                   name=\"theme\"\n                   checked={theme === 'system'}\n                   onChange={() =&gt; setTheme('system')}\n                   className=\"w-4 h-4\"\n                 /&gt;\n                 &lt;span&gt;System default&lt;/span&gt;\n               &lt;/label&gt;\n             &lt;/div&gt;\n           &lt;/section&gt;\n           \n           {/* Cache &amp; Sync */}\n           &lt;section className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg p-6\"&gt;\n             &lt;h2 className=\"font-medium text-lg mb-4\"&gt;Cache &amp; Sync&lt;/h2&gt;\n             \n             {cacheStats &amp;&amp; (\n               &lt;div className=\"mb-4 text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400\"&gt;\n                 &lt;p&gt;Cached: {cacheStats.bookCount} books, {cacheStats.authorCount} authors&lt;/p&gt;\n                 {cacheStats.lastSync &amp;&amp; (\n                   &lt;p&gt;Last synced: {new Date(cacheStats.lastSync).toLocaleString()}&lt;/p&gt;\n                 )}\n               &lt;/div&gt;\n             )}\n             \n             &lt;div className=\"flex gap-3\"&gt;\n               &lt;Button\n                 variant=\"secondary\"\n                 onClick={handleSync}\n                 loading={syncing}\n               &gt;\n                 Sync now\n               &lt;/Button&gt;\n               &lt;Button\n                 variant=\"ghost\"\n                 onClick={handleClearCache}\n                 loading={clearing}\n               &gt;\n                 Clear cache\n               &lt;/Button&gt;\n             &lt;/div&gt;\n           &lt;/section&gt;\n           \n           {/* Account */}\n           &lt;section className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg p-6\"&gt;\n             &lt;h2 className=\"font-medium text-lg mb-4\"&gt;Account&lt;/h2&gt;\n             \n             &lt;div className=\"space-y-4\"&gt;\n               &lt;Button variant=\"secondary\" onClick={logout}&gt;\n                 Sign out\n               &lt;/Button&gt;\n               \n               &lt;div className=\"pt-4 border-t dark:border-gray-700\"&gt;\n                 &lt;h3 className=\"font-medium text-red-600 mb-2\"&gt;Danger Zone&lt;/h3&gt;\n                 &lt;p className=\"text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400 mb-3\"&gt;\n                   Permanently delete your account and all your library data.\n                 &lt;/p&gt;\n                 &lt;Button\n                   variant=\"danger\"\n                   onClick={() =&gt; setShowDeleteConfirm(true)}\n                 &gt;\n                   Delete account\n                 &lt;/Button&gt;\n               &lt;/div&gt;\n             &lt;/div&gt;\n           &lt;/section&gt;\n         &lt;/div&gt;\n         \n         {/* Delete confirmation modal */}\n         {showDeleteConfirm &amp;&amp; (\n           &lt;div className=\"fixed inset-0 bg-black/50 flex items-center justify-center p-4 z-50\"&gt;\n             &lt;div className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg p-6 max-w-md w-full\"&gt;\n               &lt;h2 className=\"text-xl font-bold mb-4\"&gt;Delete account?&lt;/h2&gt;\n               &lt;p className=\"text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400 mb-6\"&gt;\n                 This will permanently delete your account and all your library data.\n                 This action cannot be undone.\n               &lt;/p&gt;\n               &lt;div className=\"flex gap-3 justify-end\"&gt;\n                 &lt;Button\n                   variant=\"secondary\"\n                   onClick={() =&gt; setShowDeleteConfirm(false)}\n                 &gt;\n                   Cancel\n                 &lt;/Button&gt;\n                 &lt;Button\n                   variant=\"danger\"\n                   onClick={handleDeleteAccount}\n                   loading={deleting}\n                 &gt;\n                   Delete permanently\n                 &lt;/Button&gt;\n               &lt;/div&gt;\n             &lt;/div&gt;\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n         )}\n       &lt;/div&gt;\n     )\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**SUCCESS CRITERIA:**\n- Theme switching works and persists\n- Cache stats are displayed\n- Sync and clear cache buttons work\n- Logout works correctly\n- Account deletion with confirmation works\n- All states have proper loading indicators\n\n**DO NOT:**\n- Add export functionality (out of scope)\n- Implement notifications settings\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n---\n\n# Phase 9: Admin &amp; Polish\n\n## Prompt 31: Admin Dashboard\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nCreate the basic admin dashboard for user and log management.\n\n**TASK: Build admin-only pages for viewing users and logs.**\n\n1. **Create &#96;app/admin/layout.tsx&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { redirect } from 'next/navigation'\n   import { getSession } from '@/lib/auth/session'\n   \n   export default async function AdminLayout({\n     children,\n   }: {\n     children: React.ReactNode\n   }) {\n     const session = await getSession()\n     \n     if (!session || session.role !== 'ADMIN') {\n       redirect('/library')\n     }\n     \n     return (\n       &lt;div className=\"min-h-screen bg-gray-100 dark:bg-gray-900\"&gt;\n         &lt;div className=\"max-w-6xl mx-auto px-4 py-6\"&gt;\n           &lt;div className=\"mb-6\"&gt;\n             &lt;h1 className=\"text-2xl font-bold\"&gt;Admin Dashboard&lt;/h1&gt;\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n           {children}\n         &lt;/div&gt;\n       &lt;/div&gt;\n     )\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Create &#96;app/api/admin/users/route.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { withAdmin } from '@/lib/api/withAuth'\n   import { prisma } from '@/lib/db'\n   import { successResponse, handleApiError } from '@/lib/api/response'\n   \n   export const GET = withAdmin(async () =&gt; {\n     try {\n       const users = await prisma.user.findMany({\n         select: {\n           id: true,\n           email: true,\n           role: true,\n           createdAt: true,\n           _count: {\n             select: { books: true },\n           },\n         },\n         orderBy: { createdAt: 'desc' },\n         take: 100,\n       })\n       \n       return successResponse({\n         users: users.map(u =&gt; ({\n           id: u.id,\n           email: u.email,\n           role: u.role,\n           createdAt: u.createdAt.toISOString(),\n           bookCount: u._count.books,\n         })),\n       })\n     } catch (error) {\n       return handleApiError(error)\n     }\n   })\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **Create &#96;lib/logging/service.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { prisma } from '@/lib/db'\n   \n   // Add a simple Log model to schema first:\n   // model Log {\n   //   id        String   @id @default(uuid())\n   //   level     String   // error, warn, info\n   //   message   String\n   //   metadata  Json?\n   //   createdAt DateTime @default(now())\n   //   @@map(\"logs\")\n   // }\n   \n   export async function logError(\n     message: string,\n     metadata?: Record&lt;string, any&gt;\n   ) {\n     try {\n       // For v1, just console.error\n       // In production, could write to DB or external service\n       console.error(&#96;[ERROR] ${message}&#96;, metadata)\n     } catch {\n       // Ignore logging errors\n     }\n   }\n   \n   export async function getRecentLogs(limit = 50) {\n     // For v1, return empty - implement DB logging later\n     return []\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n4. **Create &#96;app/admin/page.tsx&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   'use client'\n   \n   import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'\n   \n   interface User {\n     id: string\n     email: string\n     role: string\n     createdAt: string\n     bookCount: number\n   }\n   \n   export default function AdminPage() {\n     const [users, setUsers] = useState&lt;User[]&gt;([])\n     const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)\n     \n     useEffect(() =&gt; {\n       fetch('/api/admin/users')\n         .then(r =&gt; r.json())\n         .then(data =&gt; {\n           setUsers(data.users || [])\n           setLoading(false)\n         })\n         .catch(() =&gt; setLoading(false))\n     }, [])\n     \n     if (loading) {\n       return &lt;div className=\"text-center py-8\"&gt;Loading...&lt;/div&gt;\n     }\n     \n     return (\n       &lt;div className=\"space-y-6\"&gt;\n         {/* Stats */}\n         &lt;div className=\"grid grid-cols-3 gap-4\"&gt;\n           &lt;div className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg p-6\"&gt;\n             &lt;p className=\"text-3xl font-bold\"&gt;{users.length}&lt;/p&gt;\n             &lt;p className=\"text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400\"&gt;Total Users&lt;/p&gt;\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n           &lt;div className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg p-6\"&gt;\n             &lt;p className=\"text-3xl font-bold\"&gt;\n               {users.reduce((sum, u) =&gt; sum + u.bookCount, 0)}\n             &lt;/p&gt;\n             &lt;p className=\"text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400\"&gt;Total Books&lt;/p&gt;\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n           &lt;div className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg p-6\"&gt;\n             &lt;p className=\"text-3xl font-bold\"&gt;\n               {users.filter(u =&gt; {\n                 const created = new Date(u.createdAt)\n                 const weekAgo = new Date(Date.now() - 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000)\n                 return created &gt; weekAgo\n               }).length}\n             &lt;/p&gt;\n             &lt;p className=\"text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400\"&gt;New This Week&lt;/p&gt;\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n         &lt;/div&gt;\n         \n         {/* Users table */}\n         &lt;div className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg overflow-hidden\"&gt;\n           &lt;table className=\"w-full\"&gt;\n             &lt;thead className=\"bg-gray-50 dark:bg-gray-700\"&gt;\n               &lt;tr&gt;\n                 &lt;th className=\"text-left px-6 py-3 text-sm font-medium\"&gt;Email&lt;/th&gt;\n                 &lt;th className=\"text-left px-6 py-3 text-sm font-medium\"&gt;Role&lt;/th&gt;\n                 &lt;th className=\"text-left px-6 py-3 text-sm font-medium\"&gt;Books&lt;/th&gt;\n                 &lt;th className=\"text-left px-6 py-3 text-sm font-medium\"&gt;Joined&lt;/th&gt;\n               &lt;/tr&gt;\n             &lt;/thead&gt;\n             &lt;tbody className=\"divide-y divide-gray-200 dark:divide-gray-700\"&gt;\n               {users.map(user =&gt; (\n                 &lt;tr key={user.id}&gt;\n                   &lt;td className=\"px-6 py-4 text-sm\"&gt;{user.email}&lt;/td&gt;\n                   &lt;td className=\"px-6 py-4 text-sm\"&gt;\n                     &lt;span className={&#96;px-2 py-1 rounded text-xs ${\n                       user.role === 'ADMIN'\n                         ? 'bg-purple-100 text-purple-800'\n                         : 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-800'\n                     }&#96;}&gt;\n                       {user.role}\n                     &lt;/span&gt;\n                   &lt;/td&gt;\n                   &lt;td className=\"px-6 py-4 text-sm\"&gt;{user.bookCount}&lt;/td&gt;\n                   &lt;td className=\"px-6 py-4 text-sm\"&gt;\n                     {new Date(user.createdAt).toLocaleDateString()}\n                   &lt;/td&gt;\n                 &lt;/tr&gt;\n               ))}\n             &lt;/tbody&gt;\n           &lt;/table&gt;\n         &lt;/div&gt;\n       &lt;/div&gt;\n     )\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**SUCCESS CRITERIA:**\n- Admin layout restricts access to admin users\n- User list displays with book counts\n- Basic stats are shown\n- Non-admins are redirected\n\n**DO NOT:**\n- Add user management actions (edit/delete)\n- Implement complex logging infrastructure\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n---\n\n## Prompt 32: Onboarding Flow\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nCreate the onboarding tooltips for new users.\n\n**TASK: Build a simple onboarding experience for first-time users.**\n\n1. **Create &#96;lib/hooks/useOnboarding.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   'use client'\n   \n   import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'\n   \n   const ONBOARDING_KEY = 'library-onboarding-complete'\n   \n   export function useOnboarding() {\n     const [showOnboarding, setShowOnboarding] = useState(false)\n     const [step, setStep] = useState(0)\n     \n     useEffect(() =&gt; {\n       const complete = localStorage.getItem(ONBOARDING_KEY)\n       if (!complete) {\n         setShowOnboarding(true)\n       }\n     }, [])\n     \n     const nextStep = () =&gt; {\n       setStep(s =&gt; s + 1)\n     }\n     \n     const completeOnboarding = () =&gt; {\n       localStorage.setItem(ONBOARDING_KEY, 'true')\n       setShowOnboarding(false)\n     }\n     \n     const resetOnboarding = () =&gt; {\n       localStorage.removeItem(ONBOARDING_KEY)\n       setShowOnboarding(true)\n       setStep(0)\n     }\n     \n     return {\n       showOnboarding,\n       step,\n       nextStep,\n       completeOnboarding,\n       resetOnboarding,\n     }\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Create &#96;components/onboarding/onboarding-modal.tsx&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   'use client'\n   \n   import { useOnboarding } from '@/lib/hooks/useOnboarding'\n   import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'\n   \n   const STEPS = [\n     {\n       title: 'Welcome to Library Scanner! üìö',\n       content: 'Keep track of your book collection and never buy duplicates again.',\n       image: 'üì±',\n     },\n     {\n       title: 'Scan Books Instantly',\n       content: 'Use your camera to scan book barcodes. The app will automatically look up the book and add it to your library.',\n       image: 'üì∑',\n     },\n     {\n       title: 'Works Offline (for viewing)',\n       content: 'Your library is cached on your device. You can browse and search your collection even without internet. Adding new books requires a connection.',\n       image: 'üì°',\n     },\n   ]\n   \n   export function OnboardingModal() {\n     const { showOnboarding, step, nextStep, completeOnboarding } = useOnboarding()\n     \n     if (!showOnboarding) return null\n     \n     const currentStep = STEPS[step]\n     const isLastStep = step === STEPS.length - 1\n     \n     return (\n       &lt;div className=\"fixed inset-0 bg-black/50 flex items-center justify-center p-4 z-50\"&gt;\n         &lt;div className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-2xl p-8 max-w-md w-full text-center\"&gt;\n           &lt;div className=\"text-6xl mb-6\"&gt;{currentStep.image}&lt;/div&gt;\n           \n           &lt;h2 className=\"text-2xl font-bold mb-4\"&gt;{currentStep.title}&lt;/h2&gt;\n           \n           &lt;p className=\"text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400 mb-8\"&gt;\n             {currentStep.content}\n           &lt;/p&gt;\n           \n           {/* Progress dots */}\n           &lt;div className=\"flex justify-center gap-2 mb-6\"&gt;\n             {STEPS.map((_, i) =&gt; (\n               &lt;div\n                 key={i}\n                 className={&#96;w-2 h-2 rounded-full ${\n                   i === step\n                     ? 'bg-blue-600'\n                     : 'bg-gray-300 dark:bg-gray-600'\n                 }&#96;}\n               /&gt;\n             ))}\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n           \n           &lt;div className=\"flex gap-3 justify-center\"&gt;\n             {!isLastStep ? (\n               &lt;&gt;\n                 &lt;Button variant=\"ghost\" onClick={completeOnboarding}&gt;\n                   Skip\n                 &lt;/Button&gt;\n                 &lt;Button onClick={nextStep}&gt;\n                   Next\n                 &lt;/Button&gt;\n               &lt;/&gt;\n             ) : (\n               &lt;Button onClick={completeOnboarding} className=\"px-8\"&gt;\n                 Get Started\n               &lt;/Button&gt;\n             )}\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n         &lt;/div&gt;\n       &lt;/div&gt;\n     )\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **Add onboarding to library page:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   // In app/library/page.tsx\n   import { OnboardingModal } from '@/components/onboarding/onboarding-modal'\n   \n   export default function LibraryPage() {\n     return (\n       &lt;&gt;\n         &lt;OnboardingModal /&gt;\n         {/* rest of library page */}\n       &lt;/&gt;\n     )\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**SUCCESS CRITERIA:**\n- Onboarding shows on first visit\n- User can skip or complete onboarding\n- Progress dots show current step\n- Completion is persisted in localStorage\n\n**DO NOT:**\n- Create complex tooltip positioning\n- Add too many steps\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n---\n\n## Prompt 33: Final Integration and Testing\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nComplete the final integration, ensure all pieces work together, and create the README.\n\n**TASK: Wire everything together and create documentation.**\n\n1. **Create comprehensive &#96;README.md&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;markdown\n   # Library Scanner PWA\n   \n   A Progressive Web App for scanning and managing your personal book library.\n   \n   ## Features\n   \n   - üì∑ Scan book barcodes with your camera\n   - üìö Organize books by author with series grouping\n   - üîç Search your library and online databases\n   - üì• Import from Goodreads, StoryGraph, or CSV\n   - üì¥ Offline viewing of your library\n   - üåô Dark mode support\n   \n   ## Tech Stack\n   \n   - **Frontend**: Next.js 14+ (App Router), React, Tailwind CSS\n   - **Backend**: Next.js API Routes\n   - **Database**: Neon Postgres with Prisma ORM\n   - **Auth**: JWT with httpOnly cookies\n   - **Email**: Resend\n   - **Metadata**: Open Library + Google Books APIs\n   \n   ## Prerequisites\n   \n   - Node.js 18+\n   - npm or yarn\n   - Neon Postgres account (free tier works)\n   - Resend account for emails (free tier works)\n   \n   ## Local Development Setup\n   \n   1. Clone the repository:\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n      git clone &lt;repo-url&gt;\n      cd tome-tracker\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;\n   \n   2. Install dependencies:\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n      npm install\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;\n   \n   3. Copy environment variables:\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n      cp .env.example .env.local\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;\n   \n   4. Configure environment variables in &#96;.env.local&#96;:\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;\n      DATABASE_URL=postgresql://...  # From Neon dashboard\n      JWT_SECRET=your-secure-secret-min-32-chars\n      RESEND_API_KEY=re_...          # From Resend dashboard\n      NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL=http://localhost:3000\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;\n   \n   5. Run database migrations:\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n      npx prisma migrate dev\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;\n   \n   6. (Optional) Seed test data:\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n      npx prisma db seed\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;\n   \n   7. Start development server:\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n      npm run dev\n      &#96;&#96;&#96;\n   \n   8. Open http://localhost:3000\n   \n   ## Deployment to Vercel\n   \n   1. Push code to GitHub\n   \n   2. Connect repository to Vercel\n   \n   3. Configure environment variables in Vercel:\n      - &#96;DATABASE_URL&#96;\n      - &#96;JWT_SECRET&#96;\n      - &#96;RESEND_API_KEY&#96;\n      - &#96;NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL&#96; (your Vercel URL)\n   \n   4. Deploy!\n   \n   ## Testing\n   \n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   # Run all tests\n   npm test\n   \n   # Run tests in watch mode\n   npm run test:watch\n   \n   # Run specific test file\n   npm test -- __tests__/lib/isbn.test.ts\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n   \n   ### Manual Testing Checklist\n   \n   - [ ] Register new account\n   - [ ] Login/logout\n   - [ ] Password reset flow\n   - [ ] Scan a book barcode\n   - [ ] Add book manually\n   - [ ] Search online and add\n   - [ ] Import CSV file\n   - [ ] Edit book details\n   - [ ] Delete a book\n   - [ ] Test offline mode (disconnect network, browse library)\n   - [ ] Test on mobile device\n   \n   ## API Endpoints\n   \n   ### Auth\n   - &#96;POST /api/auth/register&#96; - Create account\n   - &#96;POST /api/auth/login&#96; - Login\n   - &#96;POST /api/auth/logout&#96; - Logout\n   - &#96;POST /api/auth/password-reset/request&#96; - Request reset\n   - &#96;POST /api/auth/password-reset/confirm&#96; - Confirm reset\n   \n   ### Account\n   - &#96;GET /api/account&#96; - Get current user\n   - &#96;DELETE /api/account&#96; - Delete account\n   \n   ### Library\n   - &#96;GET /api/library/sync&#96; - Get full library\n   - &#96;GET /api/library/check?isbn=...&#96; - Check ownership\n   \n   ### Books\n   - &#96;POST /api/books&#96; - Add book\n   - &#96;GET /api/books/:id&#96; - Get book\n   - &#96;PATCH /api/books/:id&#96; - Update book\n   - &#96;DELETE /api/books/:id&#96; - Delete book\n   \n   ### Lookup\n   - &#96;GET /api/lookup/isbn/:code&#96; - Lookup by ISBN\n   - &#96;GET /api/lookup/search?q=...&#96; - Search online\n   \n   ### Import\n   - &#96;POST /api/import/preview&#96; - Preview CSV\n   - &#96;POST /api/import/execute&#96; - Execute import\n   \n   ## Architecture\n   \n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n   Client (PWA)\n       ‚îÇ\n       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ React UI (Next.js App Router)\n       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Service Worker (offline caching)\n       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ IndexedDB (local library cache)\n       ‚îÇ\n       ‚ñº\n   Next.js API Routes\n       ‚îÇ\n       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Auth (JWT cookies)\n       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Library CRUD\n       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Metadata lookup\n       ‚îÇ\n       ‚ñº\n   Neon Postgres (via Prisma)\n       ‚îÇ\n       ‚ñº\n   External APIs\n       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Open Library\n       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Google Books\n       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Resend\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n   \n   ##     "content": "# Library Scanner PWA - Implementation Prompts\n# Phase 7: Import System &amp; Phase 8: PWA/Offline (Prompts 23-30)\n\n---\n\n## Prompt 23: CSV Import Parser\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nCreate the core import parsing functionality for CSV files.\n\n**TASK: Build CSV parsing with column detection and mapping.**\n\n1. **Install dependencies:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   npm install papaparse\n   npm install -D @types/papaparse\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Create &#96;lib/import/types.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   export interface ImportRow {\n     title: string\n     author: string\n     isbn?: string\n     seriesName?: string\n     seriesNumber?: number\n     publisher?: string\n     publicationYear?: number\n   }\n\n   export interface ImportMapping {\n     title: string | null\n     author: string | null\n     isbn: string | null\n     seriesName: string | null\n     seriesNumber: string | null\n     publisher: string | null\n     publicationYear: string | null\n   }\n\n   export interface ImportPreview {\n     format: 'csv' | 'goodreads' | 'storygraph'\n     totalRows: number\n     columns: string[]\n     suggestedMapping: ImportMapping\n     sampleRows: Record&lt;string, string&gt;[]\n   }\n\n   export interface ImportResult {\n     imported: number\n     duplicates: number\n     errors: Array&lt;{ row: number; error: string }&gt;\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **Create &#96;lib/import/parser.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import Papa from 'papaparse'\n   import { ImportMapping, ImportPreview, ImportRow } from './types'\n\n   // Known column names for auto-mapping\n   const COLUMN_MAPPINGS = {\n     title: ['title', 'book title', 'name', 'book name'],\n     author: ['author', 'author name', 'authors', 'author(s)', 'writer'],\n     isbn: ['isbn', 'isbn13', 'isbn-13', 'isbn10', 'isbn-10', 'asin'],\n     seriesName: ['series', 'series name', 'series title'],\n     seriesNumber: ['series number', 'book number', 'number in series', '#'],\n     publisher: ['publisher', 'publishing company'],\n     publicationYear: ['year', 'publication year', 'year published', 'original publication year'],\n   }\n\n   export function detectFormat(headers: string[]): 'goodreads' | 'storygraph' | 'csv' {\n     const headerSet = new Set(headers.map((h) =&gt; h.toLowerCase()))\n\n     // Goodreads export has specific columns\n     if (headerSet.has('book id') &amp;&amp; headerSet.has('bookshelves')) {\n       return 'goodreads'\n     }\n\n     // StoryGraph has different columns\n     if (headerSet.has('read status') &amp;&amp; headerSet.has('star rating')) {\n       return 'storygraph'\n     }\n\n     return 'csv'\n   }\n\n   export function suggestMapping(headers: string[]): ImportMapping {\n     const mapping: ImportMapping = {\n       title: null,\n       author: null,\n       isbn: null,\n       seriesName: null,\n       seriesNumber: null,\n       publisher: null,\n       publicationYear: null,\n     }\n\n     const lowerHeaders = headers.map((h) =&gt; h.toLowerCase().trim())\n\n     for (const [field, aliases] of Object.entries(COLUMN_MAPPINGS)) {\n       for (const alias of aliases) {\n         const index = lowerHeaders.findIndex((h) =&gt; h === alias || h.includes(alias))\n         if (index !== -1) {\n           ;(mapping as any)[field] = headers[index]\n           break\n         }\n       }\n     }\n\n     return mapping\n   }\n\n   export async function parseCSV(\n     file: File\n   ): Promise&lt;{ headers: string[]; rows: Record&lt;string, string&gt;[] }&gt; {\n     return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&gt; {\n       Papa.parse(file, {\n         header: true,\n         skipEmptyLines: true,\n         complete: (results) =&gt; {\n           if (results.errors.length &gt; 0) {\n             reject(new Error(results.errors[0].message))\n             return\n           }\n\n           const headers = results.meta.fields || []\n           resolve({\n             headers,\n             rows: results.data as Record&lt;string, string&gt;[],\n           })\n         },\n         error: (error) =&gt; {\n           reject(error)\n         },\n       })\n     })\n   }\n\n   export function applyMapping(\n     row: Record&lt;string, string&gt;,\n     mapping: ImportMapping\n   ): ImportRow | null {\n     const title = mapping.title ? row[mapping.title]?.trim() : null\n     const author = mapping.author ? row[mapping.author]?.trim() : null\n\n     if (!title || !author) {\n       return null\n     }\n\n     return {\n       title,\n       author,\n       isbn: mapping.isbn ? row[mapping.isbn]?.trim() : undefined,\n       seriesName: mapping.seriesName ? row[mapping.seriesName]?.trim() : undefined,\n       seriesNumber: mapping.seriesNumber\n         ? parseFloat(row[mapping.seriesNumber]) || undefined\n         : undefined,\n       publisher: mapping.publisher ? row[mapping.publisher]?.trim() : undefined,\n       publicationYear: mapping.publicationYear\n         ? parseInt(row[mapping.publicationYear]) || undefined\n         : undefined,\n     }\n   }\n\n   export async function createPreview(file: File): Promise&lt;ImportPreview&gt; {\n     const { headers, rows } = await parseCSV(file)\n     const format = detectFormat(headers)\n     const suggestedMapping = suggestMapping(headers)\n\n     return {\n       format,\n       totalRows: rows.length,\n       columns: headers,\n       suggestedMapping,\n       sampleRows: rows.slice(0, 5),\n     }\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n4. **Create &#96;lib/import/goodreads.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { ImportMapping } from './types'\n\n   export const GOODREADS_MAPPING: ImportMapping = {\n     title: 'Title',\n     author: 'Author',\n     isbn: 'ISBN13',\n     seriesName: null, // Goodreads doesn't export series directly\n     seriesNumber: null,\n     publisher: 'Publisher',\n     publicationYear: 'Original Publication Year',\n   }\n\n   // Goodreads puts series info in the title like \"Title (Series, #1)\"\n   export function extractSeriesFromTitle(title: string): {\n     cleanTitle: string\n     seriesName?: string\n     seriesNumber?: number\n   } {\n     // Common patterns: \"Title (Series, #1)\" or \"Title (Series #1)\"\n     const match = title.match(/^(.+?)\\s*\\(([^,]+?)(?:,?\\s*#?(\\d+(?:\\.\\d+)?))?\\)$/)\n\n     if (match) {\n       return {\n         cleanTitle: match[1].trim(),\n         seriesName: match[2].trim(),\n         seriesNumber: match[3] ? parseFloat(match[3]) : undefined,\n       }\n     }\n\n     return { cleanTitle: title }\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n5. **Create test &#96;__tests__/lib/import/parser.test.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest'\n   import { detectFormat, suggestMapping, applyMapping } from '@/lib/import/parser'\n   import { extractSeriesFromTitle } from '@/lib/import/goodreads'\n\n   describe('Import parser', () =&gt; {\n     describe('detectFormat', () =&gt; {\n       it('detects Goodreads format', () =&gt; {\n         const headers = ['Book Id', 'Title', 'Author', 'Bookshelves']\n         expect(detectFormat(headers)).toBe('goodreads')\n       })\n\n       it('detects StoryGraph format', () =&gt; {\n         const headers = ['Title', 'Author', 'Read Status', 'Star Rating']\n         expect(detectFormat(headers)).toBe('storygraph')\n       })\n\n       it('detects generic CSV', () =&gt; {\n         const headers = ['Title', 'Author', 'ISBN']\n         expect(detectFormat(headers)).toBe('csv')\n       })\n     })\n\n     describe('suggestMapping', () =&gt; {\n       it('maps common column names', () =&gt; {\n         const headers = ['Book Title', 'Author Name', 'ISBN-13', 'Year Published']\n         const mapping = suggestMapping(headers)\n\n         expect(mapping.title).toBe('Book Title')\n         expect(mapping.author).toBe('Author Name')\n         expect(mapping.isbn).toBe('ISBN-13')\n         expect(mapping.publicationYear).toBe('Year Published')\n       })\n     })\n\n     describe('applyMapping', () =&gt; {\n     try {\n       const formData = await request.formData()\n       const file = formData.get('file') as File | null\n\n       if (!file) {\n         return errorResponse('NO_FILE', 'No file provided', 400)\n       }\n\n       if (!file.name.endsWith('.csv')) {\n         return errorResponse('INVALID_FORMAT', 'Only CSV files are supported', 400)\n       }\n\n       const preview = await createPreview(file)\n\n       // Apply format-specific mappings\n       if (preview.format === 'goodreads') {\n         preview.suggestedMapping = GOODREADS_MAPPING\n       }\n\n       return successResponse({ preview })\n     } catch (error) {\n       return handleApiError(error)\n     }\n   })\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Create &#96;lib/import/executor.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { prisma } from '@/lib/db'\n   import { ImportMapping, ImportResult } from './types'\n   import { applyMapping } from './parser'\n   import { normalizeToIsbn13 } from '@/lib/books/isbn'\n   import { extractSeriesFromTitle } from './goodreads'\n\n   export async function executeImport(\n     userId: string,\n     rows: Record&lt;string, string&gt;[],\n     mapping: ImportMapping,\n     format: 'csv' | 'goodreads' | 'storygraph'\n   ): Promise&lt;ImportResult&gt; {\n     try {\n       // Rate limit: 5 imports per hour\n       const rateLimit = checkRateLimit(&#96;import:${session.userId}&#96;, 5, 60 * 60 * 1000)\n\n       if (!rateLimit.allowed) {\n         return errorResponse(\n           'RATE_LIMITED',\n           'Too many imports. Please wait before importing again.',\n           429\n         )\n       }\n\n       const formData = await request.formData()\n       const file = formData.get('file') as File | null\n       const file')\n         }\n\n         const data = await response.json()\n         setPreview(data.preview)\n         setMapping(data.preview.suggestedMapping)\n         setStep('mapping')\n       } catch (err) {\n         setError(err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Failed to parse file')\n       } finally {\n         setLoading(false)\n       }\n     }\n\n     const handleImport = async () =&gt; {\n       if (!file || !preview) return\n\n       setLoading(true)\n       setStep('importing')\n\n       try {\n         const formData = new FormData()\n         formData.append('file', file)\n accept=\".csv\"\n               onChange={handleFileSelect}\n               className=\"hidden\"\n             /&gt;\n\n             &lt;div className=\"text-4xl mb-4\"&gt;üìÅ&lt;/div&gt;\n\n &lt;strong&gt;Supported formats:&lt;/strong&gt;\n             &lt;/p&gt;\n             &lt;ul className=\"list-disc ml-6\"&gt;\n               &lt;li&gt;Goodreads export (My Books ‚Üí &lt;/div&gt;\n         &lt;/div&gt;\n       )\n     }\n\n     // Step 2: Mapping\n     if (step === 'mapping' &amp;&amp; preview) {\n       return (\n         &lt;div className=\"max-w-2xl mx-auto px-4 py-6\"&gt;\n           &lt;h1 className=\"text-2xl font-bold mb-6\"&gt;Import Books&lt;/h1&gt;\n\n           &lt;div className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg p-6 mb-6\"&gt;\n &lt;Button\n                 variant=\"ghost\"\n                 size=\"sm\"\n                 onClick={() =&gt; {\n                   setStep('upload')\n                   setFile(null)\n                   setPreview(null)\n                 }}\n               &gt;\n                 Change file\n               &lt;/Button&gt;\n             &lt;/div&gt;\n\n             &lt;h3 className=\"font-medium (\n                         &lt;option key={col} value={col}&gt;\n                           {col}\n                         &lt;/option&gt;\n                       ))}\n                     &lt;/select&gt;\n                   &lt;/div&gt;\n                 )\n               )}\n             &lt;/div&gt;\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n\n           {/* Preview */}\n           &lt;div className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg p-6 mb-6\"&gt;\n             &lt;h3 className=\"font-medium mb-3\"&gt;Preview&lt;/h3&gt;\n             &lt;div className=\"overflow-x-auto\"&gt;\n               &lt;table className=\"w-full text-sm\"&gt;\n                 &lt;thead&gt;\n                   &lt;tr className=\"border-b dark:border-gray-700\"&gt;\n                     &lt;th className=\"text-left py-2\"&gt;Title&lt;/th&gt;\n                     &lt;th className=\"text-left py-2\"&gt;Author&lt;/th&gt;\n                   &lt;/tr&gt;\n                 &lt;/thead&gt;\n                 &lt;tbody&gt;\n                   {preview.sampleRows.slice(0, 3).map((row, i) =&gt; (\n                     &lt;tr key={i} className=\"border-b dark:border-gray-700\"&gt;\n                       &lt;td className=\"py-2\"&gt;{mapping.title ? row[mapping.title] : '-'}&lt;/td&gt;\n                       &lt;td className=\"py-2\"&gt;{mapping.author ? row[mapping.author] : '-'}&lt;/td&gt;\n                     &lt;/tr&gt;\n                   ))}\n                 &lt;/tbody&gt;\n               &lt;/table&gt;\n             &lt;/div&gt;\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n\n           {error &amp;&amp; (\n             &lt;div className=\"bg-red-50 dark:bg-red-900/20 text-red-600 p-4 rounded-lg mb-6\"&gt;\n               {error}\n             &lt;/div&gt;\n           )}\n\n           &lt;div className=\"flex gap-4\"&gt;\n             &lt;Button\n               onClick={handleImport}\n               disabled={!mapping.title || !mapping.author}\n               className=\"flex-1\"\n             &gt;\n               Import {preview.totalRows} books\n             &lt;/Button&gt;\n             &lt;Button variant=\"secondary\" onClick={() =&gt; router.push('/library')}&gt;\n               Cancel\n             &lt;/Button&gt;\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n         &lt;/div&gt;\n       )\n     }\n\n     // Step 3: Importing\n     if (step === 'importing') {\n       return (\n         &lt;div className=\"max-w-2xl mx-auto px-4 py-6\"&gt;\n           &lt;h1 className=\"text-2xl font-bold mb-6\"&gt;Import Books&lt;/h1&gt;\n\n           &lt;div className=\"bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-lg p-8 text-center\"&gt;\n             &lt;div className=\"animate-spin text-4xl mb-4\"&gt;üìö&lt;/div&gt;\n             &lt;p className=\"text-lg font-medium\"&gt;Importing your       &lt;div className=\"text-center p-4 bg-green-50 dark:bg-green-900/20 rounded-lg\"&gt;\n                 &lt;p className=\"text-2xl font-bold text-green-600\"&gt;{result.imported}&lt;/p&gt;\n                 &lt;p className=\"text-sm text-green-700 dark:text-green-400\"&gt;Imported&lt;/p&gt;\n               &lt;/div&gt;\n               &lt;div className=\"text-center p-4 bg-yellow-50        &lt;p className=\"text-2xl font-bold text-red-600\"&gt;{result.errors.length}&lt;/p&gt;\n                 &lt;p className=\"text-sm text-red-700 dark:text-red-400\"&gt;Errors&lt;/p&gt;\n               &lt;/div&gt;\n             &lt;/div&gt;\n\n             {result.errors.length &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; (\n               &lt;details className=\"text-sm\"&gt;\n                 &lt;summary text-red-600\"&gt;\n                   {result.errors.slice(0, 10).map((err, i) =&gt; (\n                     &lt;li key={i}&gt;\n                       Row {err.row}: {err.error}\n                     &lt;/li&gt;\n                   ))}\n                   {result.errors.length &gt; 10 &amp;&amp; (\n                     &lt;li&gt;...and {result.errors.length - 10} more&lt;/li&gt;\n                   )}\n                 &lt;/ul&gt;\n               &lt;/details&gt;\n             )}\n           &lt;/div&gt;\n\n           &lt;Button onClick={() =&gt; router.push('/library')} Enrichment\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nAdd background enrichment for imported books missing metadata.\n\n**TASK: Create a service to enrich imported books with missing metadata.**\n\n1. **Create &#96;lib/enrichment/service.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { prisma } from '@/lib/db'\n   import { lookupByIsbn } from '@/lib/metadata'\n\n   interface EnrichmentResult {\n     processed: number\n     enriched: number\n     errors: number\n   }\n\n   export async function enrichUserBooks(userId: string): Promise&lt;EnrichmentResult&gt; {\n     const result: EnrichmentResult = {\n       processed: 0,\n       enriched: 0,\n       errors: 0,\n     }\n\n     // Find books that need enrichment (have ISBN but missing cover or publisher)\n     const booksToEnrich = await prisma.book.findMany({\n       where: {\n         userId,\n         isbn13: { not: null },\n         OR: [{ coverUrl: null }, { publisher: null }],\n       },\n       take: 20, // Process in batches\n     })\n\n     for (const book of booksToEnrich) {\n       result.processed++\n\n       try {\n         if (!book.isbn13) continue\n\n         const metadata = await lookupByIsbn(book.isbn13)\n\n         if (!metadata) continue\n\n         // Only update fields that are missing\n         const updates: Record&lt;string, any&gt; = {}\n\n         if (!book.coverUrl &amp;&amp; metadata.coverUrl) {\n           updates.coverUrl = metadata.coverUrl\n         }\n         if (!book.publisher &amp;&amp; metadata.publisher) {\n           updates.publisher = metadata.publisher\n         }\n         if (!book.publicationYear &amp;&amp; metadata.publishedYear) {\n           updates.publicationYear = metadata.publishedYear\n         }\n         if (book.genres.length === 0 &amp;&amp; metadata.subjects?.length) {\n           updates.genres = metadata.subjects.slice(0, 10)\n         }\n\n         if (Object.keys(updates).length &gt; 0) {\n           await prisma.book.update({\n             where: { id: book.id },\n             data: updates,\n           })\n           result.enriched++\n         }\n\n         // Small delay to avoid rate limiting\n         await new Promise((resolve) =&gt; setTimeout(resolve, 500))\n       } catch (error) {\n         console.error(&#96;Enrichment error for book ${book.id}:&#96;, error)\n         result.errors++\n       }\n     }\n\n     return result\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Create &#96;app/api/enrichment/trigger/route.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { withAuth } from '@/lib/api/withAuth'\n   import { enrichUserBooks } from '@/lib/enrichment/service'\n   import { successResponse, errorResponse, handleApiError, checkRateLimit } from '@/lib/api/response'\n\n   export const POST = withAuth(async (request, session) =&gt; {\n     try {\n       // Rate limit: 1 enrichment per 5 minutes\n       const rateLimit = checkRateLimit(&#96;enrich:${session.userId}&#96;, 1, 5 * 60 * 1000)\n\n       if (!rateLimit.allowed) {\n         return errorResponse('RATE_LIMITED', 'Enrichment already in progress', 429)\n       }\n\n       const result = await enrichUserBooks(session.userId)\n\n       return successResponse({ result })\n     } catch (error) {\n       return handleApiError(error)\n     }\n   })\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **Create &#96;app/api/enrichment/status/route.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { withAuth } from '@/lib/api/withAuth'\n   import { prisma } from '@/lib/db'\n   import { successResponse, handleApiError } from '@/lib/api/response'\n\n   export const GET = withAuth(async (request, session) =&gt; {\n     try {\n       // Count books that need enrichment\n       const needsEnrichment = await prisma.book.count({\n         where: {\n           userId: session.userId,\n           isbn13: { not: null },\n           OR: [{ coverUrl: null }, { publisher: null }],\n         },\n       })\n\n       return successResponse({\n         needsEnrichment,\n         canEnrich: needsEnrichment &gt; 0,\n       })\n     } catch (error) {\n       return handleApiError(error)\n     }\n   })\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n4. **Create enrichment UI component to add to settings or library:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   // components/enrichment/enrichment-section.tsx\n   'use client'\n\n   import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'\n   import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'\n\n   export function EnrichmentSection() {\n     const [status, setStatus] = useState&lt;{ needsEnrichment: number } | null&gt;(null)\n     const [running, setRunning] = useState(false)\n     const [result, setResult] = useState&lt;{ enriched: number } | null&gt;(null)\n\n     useEffect(() =&gt; {\n       fetch('/api/enrichment/status')\n         .then((r) =&gt; r.json())\n         .then(setStatus)\n         .catch(() =&gt; {})\n     }, [])\n\n     const handleEnrich = async () =&gt; {\n       setRunning(true)\n       try {\n         const response = await fetch('/api/enrichment/trigger', { method: 'POST' })\n         const data = await response.json()\n         setResult(data.result)\n\n         // Refresh status\n         const statusResponse = await fetch('/api/enrichment/status')\n         setStatus(await statusResponse.json())\n       } finally {\n         setRunning(false)\n       }\n     }\n\n     if (!status || status.needsEnrichment === 0) return null\n\n     return (\n       &lt;div className=\"bg-blue-50 dark:bg-blue-900/20 p-4 rounded-lg\"&gt;\n         &lt;p className=\"text-sm text-blue-800 dark:text-blue-200\"&gt;\n           {status.needsEnrichment} books may have missing metadata\n         &lt;/p&gt;\n         &lt;Button size=\"sm\" onClick={handleEnrich} loading={running} className=\"mt-2\"&gt;\n           Enrich metadata\n         &lt;/Button&gt;\n         {result &amp;&amp; (\n           &lt;p className=\"text-sm text-blue-600 mt-2\"&gt;Updated {result.enriched} books&lt;/p&gt;\n         )}\n       &lt;/div&gt;\n     )\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**SUCCESS CRITERIA:**\n- Enrichment finds books with missing metadata\n- Metadata is fetched and updated\n- Rate limiting prevents abuse\n- Status endpoint shows pending enrichment count\n\n**DO NOT:**\n- Implement automatic background jobs (manual trigger only for v1)\n- Start PWA features yet (next phase)\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n---\n\n## Prompt 27: Service Worker Setup\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nConfigure the Progressive Web App with service worker for offline support.\n\n**TASK: Set up PWA manifest and service worker configuration.**\n\n1. **Install next-pwa:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   npm install next-pwa\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Create &#96;public/manifest.json&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;json\n   {\n     \"name\": \"Library Scanner\",\n     \"short_name\": \"Library\",\n     \"description\": \"Scan and manage your personal book library\",\n     \"start_url\": \"/library\",\n     \"display\": \"standalone\",\n     \"background_color\": \"#ffffff\",\n     \"theme_color\": \"#3b82f6\",\n     \"orientation\": \"portrait\",\n     \"icons\": [\n       {\n         \"src\": \"/icons/icon-192.png\",\n         \"sizes\": \"192x192\",\n         \"type\": \"image/png\",\n         \"purpose\": \"any maskable\"\n       },\n       {\n         \"src\": \"/icons/icon-512.png\",\n         \"sizes\": \"512x512\",\n         \"type\": \"image/png\",\n         \"purpose\": \"any maskable\"\n       }\n     ]\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **Update &#96;next.config.js&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;javascript\n   const withPWA = require('next-pwa')({\n     dest: 'public',\n     register: true,\n     skipWaiting: true,\n     disable: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development',\n     runtimeCaching: [\n       {\n         urlPattern: /^https:\\/\\/covers\\.openlibrary\\.org\\/.*/i,\n         handler: 'CacheFirst',\n         options: {\n           cacheName: 'cover-images',\n           expiration: {\n             maxEntries: 500,\n             maxAgeSeconds: 60 * 60 * 24 * 30, // 30 days\n           },\n         },\n       },\n       {\n         urlPattern: /^https:\\/\\/books\\.google\\.com\\/books\\/content.*/i,\n         handler: 'CacheFirst',\n         options: {\n           cacheName: 'google-covers',\n           expiration: {\n             maxEntries: 500,\n             maxAgeSeconds: 60 * 60 * 24 * 30,\n           },\n         },\n       },\n       {\n         urlPattern: /\\/api\\/library\\/sync/,\n         handler: 'NetworkFirst',\n         options: {\n           cacheName: 'library-sync',\n           networkTimeoutSeconds: 10,\n           expiration: {\n             maxAgeSeconds: 60 * 60 * 24, // 24 hours\n           },\n         },\n       },\n     ],\n   })\n\n   /** @type {import('next').NextConfig} */\n   const nextConfig = {\n     reactStrictMode: true,\n   }\n\n   module.exports = withPWA(nextConfig)\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n4. **Create placeholder icons:**\n   Create &#96;/public/icons/&#96; directory with:\n   - &#96;icon-192.png&#96; (192x192 pixels)\n   - &#96;icon-512.png&#96; (512x512 pixels)\n\n5. **Update &#96;app/layout.tsx&#96; metadata:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   export const metadata = {\n     title: 'Library Scanner',\n   "contentsAfterEdit": "# Library Scanner PWA - Implementation Prompts\n# Phase 7: Import System &amp; Phase 8: PWA/Offline (Prompts 23-30)\n\n---\n\n## Prompt 23: CSV Import Parser\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nCreate the core import parsing functionality for CSV files.\n\n**TASK: Build CSV parsing with column detection and mapping.**\n\n1. **Install dependencies:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   npm install papaparse\n   npm install -D @types/papaparse\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Create &#96;lib/import/types.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   export interface ImportRow {\n     title: string\n     author: string\n     isbn?: string\n     seriesName?: string\n     seriesNumber?: number\n     publisher?: string\n     publicationYear?: number\n   }\n\n   export interface ImportMapping {\n     title: string | null\n     author: string | null\n     isbn: string | null\n     seriesName: string | null\n     seriesNumber: string | null\n     publisher: string | null\n     publicationYear: string | null\n   }\n\n   export interface ImportPreview {\n     format: 'csv' | 'goodreads' | 'storygraph'\n     totalRows: number\n     columns: string[]\n     suggestedMapping: ImportMapping\n     sampleRows: Record&lt;string, string&gt;[]\n   }\n\n   export interface ImportResult {\n     imported: number\n     duplicates: number\n     errors: Array&lt;{ row: number; error: string }&gt;\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **Create &#96;lib/import/parser.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import Papa from 'papaparse'\n   import { ImportMapping, ImportPreview, ImportRow } from './types'\n\n   // Known column names for auto-mapping\n   const COLUMN_MAPPINGS = {\n     title: ['title', 'book title', 'name', 'book name'],\n     author: ['author', 'author name', 'authors', 'author(s)', 'writer'],\n     isbn: ['isbn', 'isbn13', 'isbn-13', 'isbn10', 'isbn-10', 'asin'],\n     seriesName: ['series', 'series name', 'series title'],\n     seriesNumber: ['series number', 'book number', 'number in series', '#'],\n     publisher: ['publisher', 'publishing company'],\n     publicationYear: ['year', 'publication year', 'year published', 'original publication year'],\n   }\n\n   export function detectFormat(headers: string[]): 'goodreads' | 'storygraph' | 'csv' {\n     const headerSet = new Set(headers.map((h) =&gt; h.toLowerCase()))\n\n     // Goodreads export has specific columns\n     if (headerSet.has('book id') &amp;&amp; headerSet.has('bookshelves')) {\n       return 'goodreads'\n     }\n\n     // StoryGraph has different columns\n     if (headerSet.has('read status') &amp;&amp; headerSet.has('star rating')) {\n       return 'storygraph'\n     }\n\n     return 'csv'\n   }\n\n   export function suggestMapping(headers: string[]): ImportMapping {\n     const mapping: ImportMapping = {\n       title: null,\n       author: null,\n       isbn: null,\n       seriesName: null,\n       seriesNumber: null,\n       publisher: null,\n       publicationYear: null,\n     }\n\n     const lowerHeaders = headers.map((h) =&gt; h.toLowerCase().trim())\n\n     for (const [field, aliases] of Object.entries(COLUMN_MAPPINGS)) {\n       for (const alias of aliases) {\n         const index = lowerHeaders.findIndex((h) =&gt; h === alias || h.includes(alias))\n         if (index !== -1) {\n           ;(mapping as any)[field] = headers[index]\n           break\n         }\n       }\n     }\n\n     return mapping\n   }\n\n   export async function parseCSV(\n     file: File\n   ): Promise&lt;{ headers: string[]; rows: Record&lt;string, string&gt;[] }&gt; {\n     return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&gt; {\n       Papa.parse(file, {\n         header: true,\n         skipEmptyLines: true,\n         complete: (results) =&gt; {\n           if (results.errors.length &gt; 0) {\n             reject(new Error(results.errors[0].message))\n             return\n           }\n\n           const headers = results.meta.fields || []\n           resolve({\n             headers,\n             rows: results.data as Record&lt;string, string&gt;[],\n           })\n         },\n         error: (error) =&gt; {\n           reject(error)\n         },\n       })\n     })\n   }\n\n   export function applyMapping(\n     row: Record&lt;string, string&gt;,\n     mapping: ImportMapping\n   ): ImportRow | null {\n     const title = mapping.title ? row[mapping.title]?.trim() : null\n     const author = mapping.author ? row[mapping.author]?.trim() : null\n\n     if (!title || !author) {\n       return null\n     }\n\n     return {\n       title,\n       author,\n       isbn: mapping.isbn ? row[mapping.isbn]?.trim() : undefined,\n       seriesName: mapping.seriesName ? row[mapping.seriesName]?.trim() : undefined,\n       seriesNumber: mapping.seriesNumber\n         ? parseFloat(row[mapping.seriesNumber]) || undefined\n         : undefined,\n       publisher: mapping.publisher ? row[mapping.publisher]?.trim() : undefined,\n       publicationYear: mapping.publicationYear\n         ? parseInt(row[mapping.publicationYear]) || undefined\n         : undefined,\n     }\n   }\n\n   export async function createPreview(file: File): Promise&lt;ImportPreview&gt; {\n     const { headers, rows } = await parseCSV(file)\n     const format = detectFormat(headers)\n     const suggestedMapping = suggestMapping(headers)\n\n     return {\n       format,\n       totalRows: rows.length,\n       columns: headers,\n       suggestedMapping,\n       sampleRows: rows.slice(0, 5),\n     }\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n4. **Create &#96;lib/import/goodreads.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { ImportMapping } from './types'\n\n   export const GOODREADS_MAPPING: ImportMapping = {\n     title: 'Title',\n     author: 'Author',\n     isbn: 'ISBN13',\n     seriesName: null, // Goodreads doesn't export series directly\n     seriesNumber: null,\n     publisher: 'Publisher',\n     publicationYear: 'Original Publication Year',\n   }\n\n   // Goodreads puts series info in the title like \"Title (Series, #1)\"\n   export function extractSeriesFromTitle(title: string): {\n     cleanTitle: string\n     seriesName?: string\n     seriesNumber?: number\n   } {\n     // Common patterns: \"Title (Series, #1)\" or \"Title (Series #1)\"\n     const match = title.match(/^(.+?)\\s*\\(([^,]+?)(?:,?\\s*#?(\\d+(?:\\.\\d+)?))?\\)$/)\n\n     if (match) {\n       return {\n         cleanTitle: match[1].trim(),\n         seriesName: match[2].trim(),\n         seriesNumber: match[3] ? parseFloat(match[3]) : undefined,\n       }\n     }\n\n     return { cleanTitle: title }\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n5. **Create test &#96;__tests__/lib/import/parser.test.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { describe, it, expect } from 'vitest'\n   import { detectFormat, suggestMapping, applyMapping } from '@/lib/import/parser'\n   import { extractSeriesFromTitle } from '@/lib/import/goodreads'\n\n   describe('Import parser', () =&gt; {\n     describe('detectFormat', () =&gt; {\n       it('detects Goodreads format', () =&gt; {\n         const headers = ['Book Id', 'Title', 'Author', 'Bookshelves']\n         expect(detectFormat(headers)).toBe('goodreads')\n       })\n\n       it('detects StoryGraph format', () =&gt; {\n         const headers = ['Title', 'Author', 'Read Status', 'Star Rating']\n         expect(detectFormat(headers)).toBe('storygraph')\n       })\n\n       it('detects generic CSV', () =&gt; {\n         const headers = ['Title', 'Author', 'ISBN']\n         expect(detectFormat(headers)).toBe('csv')\n       })\n     })\n\n     describe('suggestMapping', () =&gt; {\n       it('maps common column names', () =&gt; {\n         const headers = ['Book Title', 'Author Name', 'ISBN-13', 'Year Published']\n         const mapping = suggestMapping(headers)\n\n         expect(mapping.title).toBe('Book Title')\n         expect(mapping.author).toBe('Author Name')\n         expect(mapping.isbn).toBe('ISBN-13')\n         expect(mapping.publicationYear).toBe('Year Published')\n       })\n     })\n\n     describe('applyMapping', () =&gt; {\n       it('extracts data using mapping', () =&gt; {\n         const row = {\n           Title: 'Mistborn',\n           Author: 'Brandon Sanderson',\n           ISBN: '9780765311788',\n         }\n         const mapping = {\n           title: 'Title',\n           author: 'Author',\n           isbn: 'ISBN',\n           seriesName: null,\n           seriesNumber: null,\n           publisher: null,\n           publicationYear: null,\n         }\n\n         const result = applyMapping(row, mapping)\n\n         expect(result).toEqual({\n           title: 'Mistborn',\n           author: 'Brandon Sanderson',\n           isbn: '9780765311788',\n         })\n       })\n\n       it('returns null for missing required fields', () =&gt; {\n         const row = { Title: 'Mistborn' }\n         const mapping = {\n           title: 'Title',\n           author: 'Author',\n           isbn: null,\n           seriesName: null,\n           seriesNumber: null,\n           publisher: null,\n           publicationYear: null,\n         }\n\n         expect(applyMapping(row, mapping)).toBeNull()\n       })\n     })\n\n     describe('extractSeriesFromTitle', () =&gt; {\n       it('extracts series from Goodreads format', () =&gt; {\n         const result = extractSeriesFromTitle('The Way of Kings (The Stormlight Archive, #1)')\n\n         expect(result.cleanTitle).toBe('The Way of Kings')\n         expect(result.seriesName).toBe('The Stormlight Archive')\n         expect(result.seriesNumber).toBe(1)\n       })\n\n       it('handles titles without series', () =&gt; {\n         const result = extractSeriesFromTitle('Standalone Book')\n\n         expect(result.cleanTitle).toBe('Standalone Book')\n         expect(result.seriesName).toBeUndefined()\n       })\n     })\n   })\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**SUCCESS CRITERIA:**\n- CSV files are parsed correctly\n- Goodreads format is detected automatically\n- Column mapping suggestions work\n- Missing required fields are handled\n- All tests pass\n\n**DO NOT:**\n- Create API routes yet (next prompt)\n- Build import UI\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n---\n\n## Prompt 24: Import API Routes\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nCreate the API routes for the import flow.\n\n**TASK: Build import preview and execute endpoints.**\n\n1. **Create &#96;app/api/import/preview/route.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { NextRequest } from 'next/server'\n   import { withAuth } from '@/lib/api/withAuth'\n   import { createPreview } from '@/lib/import/parser'\n   import { GOODREADS_MAPPING } from '@/lib/import/goodreads'\n   import { successResponse, errorResponse, handleApiError } from '@/lib/api/response'\n\n   export const POST = withAuth(async (request: NextRequest, session) =&gt; {\n     try {\n       const formData = await request.formData()\n       const file = formData.get('file') as File | null\n\n       if (!file) {\n         return errorResponse('NO_FILE', 'No file provided', 400)\n       }\n\n       if (!file.name.endsWith('.csv')) {\n         return errorResponse('INVALID_FORMAT', 'Only CSV files are supported', 400)\n       }\n\n       const preview = await createPreview(file)\n\n       // Apply format-specific mappings\n       if (preview.format === 'goodreads') {\n         preview.suggestedMapping = GOODREADS_MAPPING\n       }\n\n       return successResponse({ preview })\n     } catch (error) {\n       return handleApiError(error)\n     }\n   })\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Create &#96;lib/import/executor.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { prisma } from '@/lib/db'\n   import { ImportMapping, ImportResult } from './types'\n   import { applyMapping } from './parser'\n   import { normalizeToIsbn13 } from '@/lib/books/isbn'\n   import { extractSeriesFromTitle } from './goodreads'\n\n   export async function executeImport(\n     userId: string,\n     rows: Record&lt;string, string&gt;[],\n     mapping: ImportMapping,\n     format: 'csv' | 'goodreads' | 'storygraph'\n   ): Promise&lt;ImportResult&gt; {\n     const result: ImportResult = {\n       imported: 0,\n       duplicates: 0,\n       errors: [],\n     }\n\n     // Get existing ISBNs for duplicate detection\n     const existingBooks = await prisma.book.findMany({\n       where: { userId },\n       select: { isbn13: true },\n     })\n     const existingIsbns = new Set(existingBooks.map((b) =&gt; b.isbn13).filter(Boolean))\n\n     for (let i = 0; i &lt; rows.length; i++) {\n       try {\n         let importRow = applyMapping(rows[i], mapping)\n\n         if (!importRow) {\n           result.errors.push({\n             row: i + 1,\n             error: 'Missing required fields (title or author)',\n           })\n           continue\n         }\n\n         // Handle Goodreads series extraction\n         if (format === 'goodreads' &amp;&amp; importRow.title) {\n           const { cleanTitle, seriesName, seriesNumber } = extractSeriesFromTitle(importRow.title)\n           importRow = {\n             ...importRow,\n             title: cleanTitle,\n             seriesName: seriesName || importRow.seriesName,\n             seriesNumber: seriesNumber || importRow.seriesNumber,\n           }\n         }\n\n         // Normalize ISBN\n         const isbn13 = importRow.isbn ? normalizeToIsbn13(importRow.isbn) : null\n\n         // Check for duplicates\n         if (isbn13 &amp;&amp; existingIsbns.has(isbn13)) {\n           result.duplicates++\n           continue\n         }\n\n         // Find or create author\n         const author = await prisma.author.upsert({\n           where: {\n             userId_name: { userId, name: importRow.author },\n           },\n           update: {},\n           create: {\n             userId,\n             name: importRow.author,\n           },\n         })\n\n         // Create book\n         await prisma.book.create({\n           data: {\n             userId,\n             authorId: author.id,\n             title: importRow.title,\n             isbn13,\n             publisher: importRow.publisher,\n             publicationYear: importRow.publicationYear,\n             seriesName: importRow.seriesName,\n             seriesNumber: importRow.seriesNumber,\n             source: 'IMPORT',\n           },\n         })\n\n         // Add to existing set to prevent duplicates within import\n         if (isbn13) {\n           existingIsbns.add(isbn13)\n         }\n\n         result.imported++\n       } catch (error) {\n         result.errors.push({\n           row: i + 1,\n           error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error',\n         })\n       }\n     }\n\n     return result\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **Create &#96;app/api/import/execute/route.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { NextRequest } from 'next/server'\n   import { withAuth } from '@/lib/api/withAuth'\n   import { parseCSV } from '@/lib/import/parser'\n   import { executeImport } from '@/lib/import/executor'\n   import { successResponse, errorResponse, handleApiError, checkRateLimit } from '@/lib/api/response'\n\n   export const POST = withAuth(async (request: NextRequest, session) =&gt; {\n     try {\n       // Rate limit: 5 imports per hour\n       const rateLimit = checkRateLimit(&#96;import:${session.userId}&#96;, 5, 60 * 60 * 1000)\n\n       if (!rateLimit.allowed) {\n         return errorResponse(\n           'RATE_LIMITED',\n           'Too many imports. Please wait before importing again.',\n           429\n         )\n       }\n\n       const formData = await request.formData()\n       const file = formData.get('file') as File | null\n       const mappingStr = formData.get('mapping') as string | null\n       const format = (formData.get('format') as string) || 'csv'\n\n       if (!file || !mappingStr) {\n         return errorResponse('MISSING_DATA', 'File and mapping required', 400)\n       }\n\n       const mapping = JSON.parse(mappingStr)\n       const { rows } = await parseCSV(file)\n\n       const result = await executeImport(\n         session.userId,\n         rows,\n         mapping,\n         format as 'csv' | 'goodreads' | 'storygraph'\n       )\n\n       return successResponse({ result })\n     } catch (error) {\n       return handleApiError(error)\n     }\n   })\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n4. **Create integration test &#96;__tests__/api/import.test.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { expect(response.status).toBe(200)\n       const data = await response.json()\n\n       expect(data.result.imported).toBe(1)\n       expect(data.result.duplicates).toBe(0)\n     })\n   })\n           {field.replace(/([A-Z])/g, ' $1')}\n                       {(field === 'title' || field === 'author') &amp;&amp; ' *'}\n                     &lt;/label&gt;\n                     &lt;select\n Enrichment\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nAdd background enrichment for imported books missing metadata.\n\n**TASK: Create a service to enrich imported books with missing metadata.**\n\n1. **Create &#96;lib/enrichment/service.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { prisma } from '@/lib/db'\n   import { lookupByIsbn } from '@/lib/metadata'\n\n   interface EnrichmentResult {\n     processed: number\n     enriched: number\n     errors: number\n   }\n\n   export async function enrichUserBooks(userId: string): Promise&lt;EnrichmentResult&gt; {\n     const result: EnrichmentResult = {\n       processed: 0,\n       enriched: 0,\n       errors: 0,\n     }\n\n     // Find books that need enrichment (have ISBN but missing cover or publisher)\n     const booksToEnrich = await prisma.book.findMany({\n       where: {\n         userId,\n         isbn13: { not: null },\n         OR: [{ coverUrl: null }, { publisher: null }],\n       },\n       take: 20, // Process in batches\n     })\n\n     for (const book of booksToEnrich) {\n       result.processed++\n\n       try {\n         if (!book.isbn13) continue\n\n         const metadata = await lookupByIsbn(book.isbn13)\n\n         if (!metadata) continue\n\n         // Only update fields that are missing\n         const updates: Record&lt;string, any&gt; = {}\n\n         if (!book.coverUrl &amp;&amp; metadata.coverUrl) {\n           updates.coverUrl = metadata.coverUrl\n         }\n         if (!book.publisher &amp;&amp; metadata.publisher) {\n           updates.publisher = metadata.publisher\n         }\n         if (!book.publicationYear &amp;&amp; metadata.publishedYear) {\n           updates.publicationYear = metadata.publishedYear\n         }\n         if (book.genres.length === 0 &amp;&amp; metadata.subjects?.length) {\n           updates.genres = metadata.subjects.slice(0, 10)\n         }\n\n         if (Object.keys(updates).length &gt; 0) {\n           await prisma.book.update({\n             where: { id: book.id },\n             data: updates,\n           })\n           result.enriched++\n         }\n\n         // Small delay to avoid rate limiting\n         await new Promise((resolve) =&gt; setTimeout(resolve, 500))\n       } catch (error) {\n         console.error(&#96;Enrichment error for book ${book.id}:&#96;, error)\n         result.errors++\n       }\n     }\n\n     return result\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Create &#96;app/api/enrichment/trigger/route.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { withAuth } from '@/lib/api/withAuth'\n   import { enrichUserBooks } from '@/lib/enrichment/service'\n   import { successResponse, errorResponse, handleApiError, checkRateLimit } from '@/lib/api/response'\n\n   export const POST = withAuth(async (request, session) =&gt; {\n     try {\n       // Rate limit: 1 enrichment per 5 minutes\n       const rateLimit = checkRateLimit(&#96;enrich:${session.userId}&#96;, 1, 5 * 60 * 1000)\n\n       if (!rateLimit.allowed) {\n         return errorResponse('RATE_LIMITED', 'Enrichment already in progress', 429)\n       }\n\n       const result = await enrichUserBooks(session.userId)\n\n       return successResponse({ result })\n     } catch (error) {\n       return handleApiError(error)\n     }\n   })\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **Create &#96;app/api/enrichment/status/route.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { withAuth } from '@/lib/api/withAuth'\n   import { prisma } from '@/lib/db'\n   import { successResponse, handleApiError } from '@/lib/api/response'\n\n   export const GET = withAuth(async (request, session) =&gt; {\n     try {\n       // Count books that need enrichment\n       const needsEnrichment = await prisma.book.count({\n         where: {\n           userId: session.userId,\n           isbn13: { not: null },\n           OR: [{ coverUrl: null }, { publisher: null }],\n         },\n       })\n\n       return successResponse({\n         needsEnrichment,\n         canEnrich: needsEnrichment &gt; 0,\n       })\n     } catch (error) {\n       return handleApiError(error)\n     }\n   })\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n4. **Create enrichment UI component to add to settings or library:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   // components/enrichment/enrichment-section.tsx\n   'use client'\n\n   import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'\n   import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'\n\n   export function EnrichmentSection() {\n     const [status, setStatus] = useState&lt;{ needsEnrichment: number } | null&gt;(null)\n     const [running, setRunning] = useState(false)\n     const [result, setResult] = useState&lt;{ enriched: number } | null&gt;(null)\n\n     useEffect(() =&gt; {\n       fetch('/api/enrichment/status')\n         .then((r) =&gt; r.json())\n         .then(setStatus)\n         .catch(() =&gt; {})\n     }, [])\n\n     const handleEnrich = async () =&gt; {\n       setRunning(true)\n       try {\n         const response = await fetch('/api/enrichment/trigger', { method: 'POST' })\n         const data = await response.json()\n         setResult(data.result)\n\n         // Refresh status\n         const statusResponse = await fetch('/api/enrichment/status')\n         setStatus(await statusResponse.json())\n       } finally {\n         setRunning(false)\n       }\n     }\n\n     if (!status || status.needsEnrichment === 0) return null\n\n     return (\n       &lt;div className=\"bg-blue-50 dark:bg-blue-900/20 p-4 rounded-lg\"&gt;\n         &lt;p className=\"text-sm text-blue-800 dark:text-blue-200\"&gt;\n           {status.needsEnrichment} books may have missing metadata\n         &lt;/p&gt;\n         &lt;Button size=\"sm\" onClick={handleEnrich} loading={running} className=\"mt-2\"&gt;\n           Enrich metadata\n         &lt;/Button&gt;\n         {result &amp;&amp; (\n           &lt;p className=\"text-sm text-blue-600 mt-2\"&gt;Updated {result.enriched} books&lt;/p&gt;\n         )}\n       &lt;/div&gt;\n     )\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**SUCCESS CRITERIA:**\n- Enrichment finds books with missing metadata\n- Metadata is fetched and updated\n- Rate limiting prevents abuse\n- Status endpoint shows pending enrichment count\n\n**DO NOT:**\n- Implement automatic background jobs (manual trigger only for v1)\n- Start PWA features yet (next phase)\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n---\n\n## Prompt 27: Service Worker Setup\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nConfigure the Progressive Web App with service worker for offline \"icons\": [\n       {\n         \"src\": \"/icons/icon-192.png\",\n         \"sizes\": \"192x192\",\n         \"type\": \"image/png\",\n         \"purpose\": \"any maskable\"\n       },\n       {\n         \"src\": \"/icons/icon-512.png\",\n         \"sizes\": \"512x512\",\n         \"type\": \"image/png\",\n         \"purpose\": \"any maskable\"\n       }\n     ]\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **Update &#96;next.config.js&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;javascript\n   const withPWA = require('next-pwa')({\n     dest: 'public',\n     register: true,\n     skipWaiting: true,\n     disable: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development',\n     runtimeCaching: [\n       {\n         urlPattern: /^https:\\/\\/covers\\.openlibrary\\.org\\/.*/i,\n         handler: 'CacheFirst',\n         options: {\n           cacheName: 'cover-images',\n           expiration: {\n             maxEntries: 500,\n             maxAgeSeconds: 60 * 60 * 24 * 30, // 30 days\n           },\n         },\n       },\n       {\n         urlPattern: /^https:\\/\\/books\\.google\\.com\\/books\\/content.*/i,\n         handler: 'CacheFirst',\n         options: {\n           cacheName: 'google-covers',\n           expiration: {\n             maxEntries: 500,\n             maxAgeSeconds: 60 * 60 * 24 * 30,\n           },\n         },\n       },\n       {\n         urlPattern: /\\/api\\/library\\/sync/,\n         handler: 'NetworkFirst',\n         options: {\n           cacheName: 'library-sync',\n           networkTimeoutSeconds: 10,\n           expiration: {\n             maxAgeSeconds: 60 * 60 * 24, // 24 hours\n           },\n         },\n       },\n     ],\n   })\n\n   /** @type {import('next').NextConfig} */\n   const nextConfig = {\n     reactStrictMode: true,\n   }\n\n   module.exports = withPWA(nextConfig)\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n4. **Create placeholder icons:**\n   Create &#96;/public/icons/&#96; directory with:\n   - &#96;icon-192.png&#96; (192x192 pixels)\n   - &#96;icon-512.png&#96; (512x512 pixels)\n\n5. **Update &#96;app/layout.tsx&#96; metadata:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   export const metadata = {\n     title: 'Library Scanner',\n     description: 'Scan and manage your personal book library',\n     manifest: '/manifest.json',\n     appleWebApp: {\n       capable: true,\n       statusBarStyle: 'default',\n       title: 'Library Scanner',\n     },\n   }\n\n   export const viewport = {\n     width: 'device-width',\n     initialScale: 1,\n     maximumScale: 1,\n     userScalable: false,\n     themeColor: '#3b82f6',\n     viewportFit: 'cover',\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n6. **Add Apple-specific meta tags to layout head:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   // In app/layout.tsx, add to &lt;head&gt;\n   &lt;link rel=\"apple-touch-icon\" href=\"/icons/icon-192.png\" /&gt;\n   &lt;meta name=\"apple-mobile-web-app-capable\" content=\"yes\" /&gt;\n   &lt;meta name=\"apple-mobile-web-app-status-bar-style\"
