IndexedDB Local Cache\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nImplement IndexedDB caching for offline library access.\n\n**TASK: Create IndexedDB storage for offline library data.**\n\n1. **Install idb:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;bash\n   npm install idb\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n2. **Create &#96;lib/offline/db.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   import { openDB, DBSchema, IDBPDatabase } from 'idb'\n\n   interface LibraryDB extends DBSchema {\n     authors: {\n       key: string\n       value: {\n         id: string\n         name: string\n         bio: string | null\n         photoUrl: string | null\n       }\n       indexes: { 'by-name': string }\n     }\n     books: {\n       key: string\n       value: {\n         id: string\n         authorId: string\n         title: string\n         isbn13: string | null\n         coverUrl: string | null\n         seriesName: string | null\n         seriesNumber: number | null\n       }\n       indexes: { 'by-author': string; 'by-isbn': string }\n     }\n     metadata: {\n       key: string\n       value: {\n         key: string\n         value: string\n         updatedAt: string\n       }\n     }\n   }\n\n   let dbPromise: Promise&lt;IDBPDatabase&lt;LibraryDB&gt;&gt; | null = null\n\n   function getDB() {\n     if (!dbPromise) {\n       dbPromise = openDB&lt;LibraryDB&gt;('tome-tracker', 1, {\n         upgrade(db) {\n           // Authors store\n           const authorStore = db.createObjectStore('authors', { keyPath: 'id' })\n           authorStore.createIndex('by-name', 'name')\n\n           // Books store\n           const bookStore = db.createObjectStore('books', { keyPath: 'id' })\n           bookStore.createIndex('by-author', 'authorId')\n           bookStore.createIndex('by-isbn', 'isbn13')\n\n           // Metadata store (for sync timestamps, etc.)\n           db.createObjectStore('metadata', { keyPath: 'key' })\n         },\n       })\n     }\n     return dbPromise\n   }\n\n   export async function cacheLibraryData(\n     authors: LibraryDB['authors']['value'][],\n     books: LibraryDB['books']['value'][]\n   ) {\n     const db = await getDB()\n     const tx = db.transaction(['authors', 'books', 'metadata'], 'readwrite')\n\n     // Clear existing data\n     await tx.objectStore('authors').clear()\n     await tx.objectStore('books').clear()\n\n     // Add new data\n     for (const author of authors) {\n       await tx.objectStore('authors').put(author)\n     }\n\n     for (const book of books) {\n       await tx.objectStore('books').put(book)\n     }\n\n     // Update sync timestamp\n     await tx.objectStore('metadata').put({\n       key: 'lastSync',\n       value: new Date().toISOString(),\n       updatedAt: new Date().toISOString(),\n     })\n\n     await tx.done\n   }\n\n   export async function getCachedLibrary() {\n     const db = await getDB()\n\n     const [authors, books, syncMeta] = await Promise.all([\n       db.getAll('authors'),\n       db.getAll('books'),\n       db.get('metadata', 'lastSync'),\n     ])\n\n     return {\n       authors,\n       books,\n       lastSync: syncMeta?.value || null,\n     }\n   }\n\n   export async function checkOwnershipOffline(isbn13: string): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {\n     const db = await getDB()\n     const book = await db.getFromIndex('books', 'by-isbn', isbn13)\n     return book !== null\n   }\n\n   export async function searchBooksOffline(query: string) {\n     const db = await getDB()\n     const books = await db.getAll('books')\n     const authors = await db.getAll('authors')\n\n     const authorMap = new Map(authors.map((a) =&gt; [a.id, a]))\n     const lowerQuery = query.toLowerCase()\n\n     return books.filter((book) =&gt; {\n       const author = authorMap.get(book.authorId)\n       return (\n         book.title.toLowerCase().includes(lowerQuery) ||\n         author?.name.toLowerCase().includes(lowerQuery)\n       )\n     })\n   }\n\n   export async function getCacheStats() {\n     const db = await getDB()\n\n     const [authorCount, bookCount, syncMeta] = await Promise.all([\n       db.count('authors'),\n       db.count('books'),\n       db.get('metadata', 'lastSync'),\n     ])\n\n     return {\n       authorCount,\n       bookCount,\n       lastSync: syncMeta?.value || null,\n     }\n   }\n\n   export async function clearCache() {\n     const db = await getDB()\n     const tx = db.transaction(['authors', 'books', 'metadata'], 'readwrite')\n\n     await tx.objectStore('authors').clear()\n     await tx.objectStore('books').clear()\n     await tx.objectStore('metadata').clear()\n\n     await tx.done\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n3. **Create &#96;lib/hooks/useOfflineLibrary.ts&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   'use client'\n\n   import { useState, useEffect, useCallback } from 'react'\n   import {\n     getCachedLibrary,\n     cacheLibraryData,\n     searchBooksOffline,\n     getCacheStats,\n     clearCache,\n   } from '@/lib/offline/db'\n\n   export function useOfflineLibrary() {\n     const [isOnline, setIsOnline] = useState(true)\n     const [cacheStats, setCacheStats] = useState&lt;{\n       bookCount: number\n       authorCount: number\n       lastSync: string | null\n     } | null&gt;(null)\n\n     // Track online/offline status\n     useEffect(() =&gt; {\n       setIsOnline(navigator.onLine)\n\n       const handleOnline = () =&gt; setIsOnline(true)\n       const handleOffline = () =&gt; setIsOnline(false)\n\n       window.addEventListener('online', handleOnline)\n       window.addEventListener('offline', handleOffline)\n\n       return () =&gt; {\n         window.removeEventListener('online', handleOnline)\n         window.removeEventListener('offline', handleOffline)\n       }\n     }, [])\n\n     // Load cache stats\n     useEffect(() =&gt; {\n       getCacheStats().then(setCacheStats).catch(() =&gt; {})\n     }, [])\n\n     const syncAndCache = useCallback(async () =&gt; {\n       if (!navigator.onLine) return false\n\n       try {\n         const response = await fetch('/api/library/sync')\n         if (!response.ok) return false\n\n         const data = await response.json()\n\n         // Transform data for caching\n         const authors = data.authors.map((a: any) =&gt; ({\n           id: a.id,\n           name: a.name,\n           bio: a.bio,\n           photoUrl: a.photoUrl,\n         }))\n\n         const books = data.authors.flatMap((a: any) =&gt;\n           a.books.map((b: any) =&gt; ({\n             id: b.id,\n             authorId: a.id,\n             title: b.title,\n             isbn13: b.isbn13,\n             coverUrl: b.coverUrl,\n             seriesName: b.seriesName,\n             seriesNumber: b.seriesNumber,\n           }))\n         )\n\n         await cacheLibraryData(authors, books)\n         setCacheStats(await getCacheStats())\n\n         return true\n       } catch {\n         return false\n       }\n     }, [])\n\n     const searchOffline = useCallback(async (query: string) =&gt; {\n       return searchBooksOffline(query)\n     }, [])\n\n     const getCached = useCallback(async () =&gt; {\n       return getCachedLibrary()\n     }, [])\n\n     const clearLocalCache = useCallback(async () =&gt; {\n       await clearCache()\n       setCacheStats(await getCacheStats())\n     }, [])\n\n     return {\n       isOnline,\n       cacheStats,\n       syncAndCache,\n       searchOffline,\n       getCached,\n       clearLocalCache,\n     }\n   }\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**SUCCESS CRITERIA:**\n- IndexedDB stores library data\n- Offline search works on cached data\n- Cache stats are available\n- Clear cache function works\n- Online/offline status is tracked\n\n**DO NOT:**\n- Build offline UI indicators yet (next prompt)\n- Implement background sync\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n---\n\n## Prompt 29: Offline Mode UI\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;text\nCreate the offline mode user interface and indicators.\n\n**TASK: Build offline indicators and behavior throughout the app.**\n\n1. **Create &#96;components/offline/offline-banner.tsx&#96;:**\n   &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n   'use client'\n\n   import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'\n\n   export function OfflineBanner() {\n     const [isOnline, setIsOnline] = useState(true)\n\n     useEffect(() =&gt; {\n       setIsOnline(navigator.onLine)\n\n       const handleOnline = () =&gt; setIsOnline(true)\n       const handleOffline = () =&gt; setIsOnline(false)\n\n       window.addEventListener('online', handleOnline)\n       window.addEventListener('offline',     "content": "import { cookies } from \"next/headers\";\nimport { createToken, verifyToken, SessionPayload } from \"./jwt\";\n\nconst COOKIE_NAME = \"session\";\n\nconst getCookieOptions = () =&gt; ({\n  httpOnly: true,\n  secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === \"production\",\n  sameSite: \"lax\" as const,\n  path: \"/\",\n  maxAge: 60 * 60 * 24 * 7, // 7 days\n});\n\nexport async function createSession(user: {\n  id: string;\n  email: string;\n  role: \"USER\" | \"ADMIN\";\n}): Promise&lt;void&gt; {\n  const token = await createToken({\n    userId: user.id,\n    email: user.email,\n    role: user.role,\n  });\n\n  const cookieStore = cookies();\n  cookieStore.set(COOKIE_NAME, token, getCookieOptions());\n}\n\nexport async function getSession(): Promise&lt;SessionPayload | null&gt; {\n  const cookieStore = cookies();\n  const token = cookieStore.get(COOKIE_NAME)?.value;\n\n  if (!token) return null;\n  return verifyToken(token);\n}\n\nexport async function destroySession(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {\n  const cookieStore = cookies();\n  cookieStore.delete(COOKIE_NAME);\n}\n\nexport async function requireAuth(): Promise&lt;SessionPayload&gt; {\n  const session = await getSession();\n  if (!session) {\n    throw new Error(\"Unauthorized\");\n  }\n  return session;\n}\n\nexport async function requireAdmin(): Promise&lt;SessionPayload&gt; {\n  const session = await requireAuth();\n  if (session.role !== \"ADMIN\") {\n    throw new Error(\"Forbidden\");\n  }\n  return session;\n}\n\nexport { type SessionPayload };\n",
    "languageId": "typescript"
  }
}

The payload must be Uint8Array error likely stems from mixing Node and browser/webapi versions of jose in the jsdom test environment where SignJWT or CompactSign expects a Uint8Array payload, but the passed payload is still an object. This hints at a bundling or import mismatch causing usage of the browser-specific `SignJWT` expecting different input types than Node's version.</details></think>

    "content": "import { NextRequest } from \"next/server\";\nimport { randomBytes } from \"crypto\";\nimport { prisma } from \"@/lib/db\";\nimport { emailSchema } from \"@/lib/auth/validation\";\nimport { sendPasswordResetEmail } from \"@/lib/email/resend\";\nimport { successResponse, handleApiError } from \"@/lib/api/response\";\n\nexport async function POST(request: NextRequest) {\n  try {\n    const body = await request.json();\n    const email = emailSchema.parse(body.email);\n\n    const appUrl =\n      process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL || \"http://localhost:3000\";\n\n    // Find user (but don't reveal if they exist)\n    const user = await prisma.user.findUnique({\n      where: { email },\n    });\n\n    if (user) {\n      // Delete any existing tokens for this user\n      await prisma.passwordResetToken.deleteMany({\n        where: { userId: user.id },\n      });\n\n      // Create new token\n      const token = randomBytes(32).toString(\"hex\");\n      const expiresAt = new Date(Date.now() + 60 * 60 * 1000); // 1 hour\n\n      await prisma.passwordResetToken.create({\n        data: {\n          userId: user.id,\n          token,\n          expiresAt,\n        },\n      });\n\n      // Send email\n      const resetUrl = &#96;${appUrl}/reset-password?token=${token}&#96;;\n      await sendPasswordResetEmail(email, resetUrl);\n    }\n\n    // Always return success to prevent email enumeration\n    return successResponse({\n      message: \"If an account exists, a reset email has been sent\",\n    });\n  } catch (error) {\n    return handleApiError(error);\n  }\n}\n",
    "languageId": "typescript"
  }
}

    "content": "import { NextRequest } from \"next/server\";\nimport { z } from \"zod\";\nimport { prisma } from \"@/lib/db\";\nimport { hashPassword } from \"@/lib/auth/password\";\nimport { passwordSchema } from \"@/lib/auth/validation\";\nimport {\n  successResponse,\n  errorResponse,\n  handleApiError,\n} from \"@/lib/api/response\";\n\nconst confirmSchema = z.object({\n  token: z.string().min(1, \"Token is required\"),\n  password: passwordSchema,\n});\n\nexport async function POST(request: NextRequest) {\n  try {\n    const body = await request.json();\n    const { token, password } = confirmSchema.parse(body);\n\n    // Find valid token\n    const resetToken = await prisma.passwordResetToken.findUnique({\n      where: { token },\n    });\n\n    if (!resetToken) {\n      return errorResponse(\n        \"INVALID_TOKEN\",\n        \"This reset link is invalid or has expired\",\n        400\n      );\n    }\n\n    if (resetToken.expiresAt &lt; new Date()) {\n      // Clean up expired token\n      await prisma.passwordResetToken.delete({\n        where: { id: resetToken.id },\n      });\n      return errorResponse(\n        \"INVALID_TOKEN\",\n        \"This reset link is invalid or has expired\",\n        400\n      );\n    }\n\n    // Update password\n    await prisma.user.update({\n      where: { id: resetToken.userId },\n      data: { passwordHash: await hashPassword(password) },\n    });\n\n    // Delete token\n    await prisma.passwordResetToken.delete({\n      where: { id: resetToken.id },\n    });\n\n    return successResponse({\n      message: \"Password has been reset successfully\",\n    });\n  } catch (error) {\n    return handleApiError(error);\n  }\n}\n",
    "languageId": "typescript"
  }
}

    "languageId": "typescript"
  }
}

{\n  const testEmail = &#96;account-test-${Date.now()}@example.com&#96;;\n  let sessionCookie: string;\n  let userId: string;\n\n  beforeEach(async () =&gt; {\n    // Create user\n    const user = await prisma.user.create({\n      data: {\n        email: testEmail,\n        passwordHash: await hashPassword(\"TestPassword123!\"),\n      },\n    });\n    userId = user.id;\n\n    // Login to get session cookie\n    const loginResponse = await fetch(\"http://localhost:3000/api/auth/login\", {\n      method: \"POST\",\n      headers: { \"Content-Type\": \"application/json\" },\n      body: JSON.stringify({\n        email: testEmail,\n        password: \"TestPassword123!\",\n      }),\n    });\n\n    const cookies = loginResponse.headers.get(\"set-cookie\");\n    sessionCookie = cookies!.split(\";\")[0];\n  });\n\n  afterEach(async () =&gt; {\n    // Clean up if user still exists\n    await prisma.user\n      .delete({ where: { id: userId } })\n      .catch(() =&gt; {}); // Ignore if already deleted\n  });\n\n  it(\"returns current user info\", async () =&gt; {\n    const response = await fetch(\"http://localhost:3000/api/account\", {\n      headers: { Cookie: sessionCookie },\n    });\n\n    expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n    const data = await response.json();\n    expect(data.user.email).toBe(testEmail);\n    expect(data.user.role).toBe(\"USER\");\n    expect(data.user.bookCount).toBe(0);\n  });\n\n  it(\"rejects unauthenticated requests\", async () =&gt; {\n    const response = await fetch(\"http://localhost:3000/api/account\");\n    expect(response.status).toBe(401);\n  });\n\n  it(\"deletes account and all data\", async () =&gt; {\n    // First, create some data for this user\n    const author = await prisma.author.create({\n      data: {\n        userId,\n        name: \"Test Author\",\n      },\n    });\n\n    await prisma.book.create({\n      data: {\n        userId,\n        authorId: author.id,\n        title: \"Test Book\",\n        source: \"MANUAL\",\n      },\n    });\n\n    // Delete account\n    const response = await fetch(\"http://localhost:3000/api/account\", {\n      method: \"DELETE\",\n      headers: { Cookie: sessionCookie },\n    });\n\n    expect(response.status).toBe(200);\n\n    // Verify user is deleted\n    const deletedUser = await prisma.user.findUnique({\n      where: { id: userId },\n    });\n    expect(deletedUser).toBeNull();\n\n    // Verify cascade delete worked (books should be deleted)\n    const orphanedBooks = await prisma.book.findMany({\n      where: { userId },\n    });\n    expect(orphanedBooks).toHaveLength(0);\n\n    // Verify authors are deleted too\n    const orphanedAuthors = await prisma.author.findMany({\n      where: { userId },\n    });\n    expect(orphanedAuthors).toHaveLength(0);\n  });\n});\n",

  }
}
